classSpec.desc: provides attributes for selecting particular elements within a document by means of XPath.

attDef.desc: points at one or several elements or sets of elements by means of one or more data pointers, using the URI syntax.
attDef.valDesc: a series of one or more identifiers (URIs), separated by whitespace

remarks.p: If more than one identifier is given, the implication is that all elements (or nodesets) are intended. The match attribute may also be used as a means of identifying groups of elements.

attDef.desc: supplies an arbitrary XPath expression identifying a set of nodes, selected within the context identified by the target attribute if this is supplied, or by the parent element if it is not.
attDef.valDesc: Any XPath expression using the syntax defined in .

remarks.p: The evaluation context for the expression is the node or nodes identified by target, or, if no value is given for target, the parent element.
